intro: Cyathocephalum, commonly known as the "cup-shaped head plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a dense cluster of small flowers surrounded by a cup-like structure formed by fused bracts. The plants typically have a low-growing, succulent habit with fleshy leaves and showy, often brightly colored flowers. They are native to southern Africa, where they thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Cyathocephalum species are popular among succulent enthusiasts due to their ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
